meanings.definition: To work, write, or study laboriously, especially at night.
meanings.sent1: She had to lucubrate on her essay until late into the night.
meanings.sent2: The students decided to lucubrate on their project to ensure it was perfect.
meanings.sent3: John lucubrated on his math homework until the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent4: The writer would lucubrate on his novel, crafting each sentence with care.
meanings.sent5: The scientist would lucubrate in the lab, conducting experiments tirelessly.

meanings.sent1: The professor would lucubrate on various topics to publish his research.
meanings.sent2: Authors lucubrate to create academic papers that contribute to their field.
meanings.sent3: The historian lucubrated on ancient texts to uncover new insights.
meanings.sent4: The artist would lucubrate on his paintings, adding intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The scholar would lucubrate on theories, expanding the knowledge in the field.
